ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a lot of experience in dealing with Classical Chinese poetry, as well as lots of niche knowledge about the diversity present within this particular genre of Chinese poetry.
I learned the ancient and medieval Chinese poems as well as the historical context of these tests.

learnt a lot about the poetry from Han to the six dynasties
the transformation of the poetic form
the translation assignments are so interesting and a well-training of one's literary sensitivity
R e a d i n g   P o e m s

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Maybe more secondary sources on poetry during this period? I wasn't quite sure about how to make sense of the poems most of the time, although going over them in class was helpful. The push for us to produce translations each week was pretty difficult, but I feel less averse to it now.
The course is very structurized and the workload is reasonable.
This course has been well-organised and the engagement of students is high. The workload is average.

There can be fewer student discussion time, and more lecturing by the professor, seeing as there were quite a few comments that did not really lead the discussion anywhere simply due to lack of expertise.
it's great yet I do hope that there could be more discussions on a deeper level - sometimes we are mainly doing translations in turn as there're lots of texts to handle

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! Especially to people who think that Chinese poetry is boring!! This really changed how I view Chinese poetry.
Yes, to anyone who wishes to polish their close reading skills.

Highly recommended. Luke Bender has been a helpful, erudite, and warm teacher. This course has been well-organised and the engagement of students is high. The workload is averagetranslating poems and discussing on class. He knows everything about medieval poetry.
yes, Prof.Bender is great, so is the course
I would absolutely recommend this class to another student!
